TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SoapFieldAttribute extends System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute

Docs.summary: Customizes SOAP generation and processing for a field. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The target objects for the SoapFieldAttribute attribute are object fields. The SoapFieldAttribute attribute is used to specify information that controls how the .NET Framework generates the SOAP XML wire format for target fields.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates customization of SOAP generated for a field of a class with the SoapFieldAttribute. The SOAP can be produced by the code shown in the <xref:System.SerializableAttribute> class example.
[!CODE [SoapAttributes1#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributes1#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsInteropXmlElement() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current attribute contains interop XML element values.
Docs.returns: `true` if the current attribute contains interop XML element values; otherwise, `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the order of the current field attribute.
Docs.value: The order of the current field attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You should not use this property; it is not used by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML element name of the field contained in the <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapFieldAttribute"> attribute.
Docs.value: The XML element name of the field contained in this attribute.
